item.title: Indiana Jones and The Great Circle Releases on PS5 Next Month
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/indiana-jones-and-the-great-circle-releases-on-ps5-next-month/

Indiana Jones and The Great Circle finally has a PS5 release date: April 17, 2025.

The official PlayStation account on X has finally provided Indy fans with what they have been waiting for: a release date for Indiana Jones and the Great Circle. After months of speculation, leaks and rumours, we now know that MachineGames’ latest action-adventure will be available on a new platform in less than a month. 

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle PS5 Editions and Pre-order Details

A report by Gematsu reveals that there are three editions of Indiana Jones and the Great Circle Up for grabs on the PS5. The standard edition, priced at ($69.99 / £69.99 / €79.99) will provide players with just the base game. The Premium edition will cost players ($99.99 / £99.99 / €109.99) and provides players with two days of early access, a digital art book, the ‘Temple of Doom’ outfit and access to story DLC, “The Order of the Giants”, once it releases. 

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle’s release on the PS5 is also celebrated with a Collector’s Bundle. It will feature all the Premium Edition content along with a Jump SteelBook display case, The Great Circle globe with Hidden Storage, Allmaker Relic and The Adventure Journal. 

Players who pre-order any edition of Indiana Jones and the Great Circle on the PlayStation Store will receive ‘The Last Crusade Pack’, which includes the “Traveling Suit” outfit and the “Lion Tamer” whip. 

In other news, more Indiana Jones games are being developed. What are your thoughts on Indiana Jones and the Great Circle releasing on PS5 next month? Let us know in the comments or on our community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about a new claim stating that Pokemon Legends Z-A will introduce 27 new mega-evolutions. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Team Rocket Returns to Pokémon TCG with Upcoming Destined Rivals Set
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/team-rocket-returns-to-pokemon-tcg-with-upcoming-destined-rivals-set/

Pokémon TCG has just announced a brand new set for May 30, 2025, Destined Rivals, and it will see the return of Team Rocket in the real-life card game. 

Will You Join the Trainers or Team Rocket?

Pokémon TCG has just announced the Scarlet & Violet Destined Rivals expansion for the game, and it will introduce some of the most iconic members of Team Rocket and their Pokémon to the game. Players can either join the side of Trainers like Cynthia and Garchomp ex, Ethan and Ho-Oh ex, and Arven and Mabosstiff ex or go to the dark side and join hands with Giovanni and his Mewtwo ex. 

Pokemon TCG’s Destined Rivals set will introduce over 240 cards to the game, which include over 85 Trainer’s Pokémon and over 45 Team Rocket’s Pokémon. Players should expect more than 15 Pokémon Ex and 20 Trainer Cards. Lastly, more than 45 Pokémon and Trainer cards will feature special illustrations. 

Journey Together Expansion Arrives This Week

Pokémon TCG’s next set will arrive right on time after players have had their fill with the Journey Together expansion. Journey Together is a new expansion from the Scarlet and Violet series, releasing March 28, 2025. The latest expansion will feature over 180 cards, with popular Trainer’s Pokémon like N’s Zoroark, N’s Reshiram and more. 

In other news, Pokémon TCG Pocket’s Shining Revelry expansion finally adds shiny Pokémon to the game. Also, TCG Pocket’s finally has a competitor, Digimon Alysion. What are your thoughts on Pokémon TCG’s Destined Rivals set? Let us know in the comments or on our community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about a new claim stating that Pokemon Legends Z-A will introduce 27 new mega-evolutions. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
